passages.text:
You wake up in a dark, cramped cell, unsure how long you've been there. As you sit up and place your feet on the stone floor, you hear clanking sounds coming from the hallway outside your cell. A guard is sliding a plate through the bars, containing half a loaf of stale, moldy bread and a mug of water.

[[Go back to sleep->A Rude Awakening]]
[[Eat the food->A key?]]
[[Yell for help->No justice]]
passages.name: Dungeon

passages.text:
You wake up to a hunger pang. You realize you can't remember the last time you ate. The moldy bread and water are still by the entrance to your cell. It's not ideal, but surely eating anything at this point is better than starving, right?

[[Eat the food->A key?]]
[[Yell for help->No justice]]
[[Go back to sleep->A Rude Awakening]]
passages.name: A Rude Awakening

passages.text:
You tear off a chunk of the bread, eager to finally have something to eat. A few bites in, you notice what appears to be a piece of metal lodged inside the loaf. Upon investigating further, you realize that it's a key. Someone on the outside wants to help you escape!

[[Plan your escape->Key to freedom]]
[[Keep eating with the key inside the food->Passing the Time]]

links.name: Keep eating with the key inside the food

passages.name: A key?

passages.text:
You yell to the guard to help you, asking him where you are and how you got there. The guard only hollars that you need to quiet down and be grateful that he brought you food.

[[Eat the food->A key?]] 
[[Go back to sleep->A Rude Awakening]]
passages.name: No justice

passages.text:
You carefully peer outside your cell and see what looks like the shadow of a guard standing around a corner.

[[Make your escape->Caught!]]
[[Wait until the coast is clear then make your escape->Out of the Frying Pan]]

links.name: Wait until the coast is clear then make your escape

passages.name: Key to freedom

passages.text:
You've never been a picky eater, and this is no exception. You swallow the key alongside the bread and wash it all down with water.

The next few days go by normally, until it comes time to pass the key. It's a gruelling process, but eventually the key is once again on the floor in front of you, albeit a bit less clean than before.

[[Leave it->Was it worth it?]]
[[Plan your escape->Key to freedom]]
passages.name: Passing the Time

passages.text:
The next day, a guard notices the key on the floor in your cell. He examines the key, tests it on your cell door, and confirms that it did unlock your cell. You are accused of attempting to escape, and executed soon after.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Was it worth it?

passages.text:
The lock clicks as you enter the key into it, and the door creaks open. Really loudly. The guard is alerted to your attempted escape and begins walking toward you. You only have a few seconds to react.

[[Try talking your way out of it->Honeyed Words]]
[[Hide->In the Shadows]]

links.name: Try talking your way out of it

passages.name: Caught!

passages.text:
You wait for the opportune time to escape and find it in a short gap between the guards' shifts. You slip out of your cell undetected and take the door leading out of the dungeon without attracting any unwanted attention.

[[Continue your escape->A Fork in the Road]]
passages.name: Out of the Frying Pan

passages.text:
The guard confronts you, asking you what you're doing outside your cell. He appears young and nervous, stumbling over his words a bit. It's your lucky day; the guard is new, and this may even be his first shift. 

Thinking quickly, you point out that if his boss found out about this incident, he would get into trouble for not being able to keep watch over the prisoners. It would be best to look the other way and let someone else take the blame for the escaped prisoner.

Miraculously, the guard nervously agrees and you continue your escape.

[[Keep going->A Fork in the Road]]
passages.name: Honeyed Words

passages.text:
You slip into the darkest corner of the dimly lit hallway, trying not to make a sound. The guard inspects your cell and realizes that it's empty, then begins looking around. You hold your breath as he gets closer and closer, until the two of you lock eyes.

[[Try talking your way out of it->Honeyed Words]] 
[[Remain silent->Defeat!]]

links.name: Try talking your way out of it

passages.name: In the Shadows

passages.text:
You exit the dungeon to realize you are not free yet. In fact, your escape is only just beginning. 

On the floor in front of you is a plush, red carpet. The walls around you are made of stone and feature large, elaborate paintings. You are in the middle of a castle, and there are bound to be guards everywhere.

To your left, there is a hallway lined with doors. To your right, a hallway leads to an archway that appears to open into a large room.

[[Go left->Armory]]
[[Go right->Banquet Hall]]
passages.name: A Fork in the Road

passages.text:
The guard places you back in your cell and removes the key from your possession. Weeks go by with no more chances of escape. You are executed shortly after for your crimes.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Defeat!

passages.text:
You go to the left and enter the first door you see. Before you is a room full of armor, weapons, and training dummies. There is one guard in the room who appears to be training. She hasn't noticed you yet. There is a table in front of you with a set of guard's armor, a sword, and a shield.

[[Disguise yourself as a guard with the items on the table->A little loose]]
[[Go back->Hallway]]

links.name: Disguise yourself as a guard with the items on the table

passages.name: Armory

passages.text:
You go to the right and approach the archway. Peering through, you see a massive room with a huge dining table in the middle. The table is lined with wooden chairs, with an extravagant throne at the head. In addition to the archway you are peering through, there are three doors in banquet hall: one to the left of the table, one to the right, and one behind it. You wonder where they go to, but each door has a guard standing on either side of it, so you best not investigate further.

[[Go back->Hallway]]
[[Enter the room->Spotted!]]
passages.name: Banquet Hall

passages.text:
The armor doesn't fit you quite right, but you at least look more like a guard than you do an escaped prisoner. You should be able to walk freely through the castle now, provided that you stay in character.

The guard in the armory continues to train, seemingly oblivious to your presence.

[[Strike up conversation with the guard->A Fighting Chance]]
[[Exit the armory->On Patrol]]

links.name: Strike up conversation with the guard

passages.name: A little loose

passages.text:
On the floor in front of you is a plush, red carpet. The walls around you are made of stone and feature large, elaborate paintings. You are in the middle of a castle, and there are bound to be guards everywhere.

To your left, there is a hallway lined with doors. To your right, a hallway leads to an archway that appears to open into a large room.

[[Go left->Armory]]
[[Go right->Banquet Hall]]
passages.name: Hallway

passages.text:
You enter the banquet hall, and are immediately confronted by all six guards. They take no pity on you, and throw you back in your cell. You are executed for your crimes shortly after.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Spotted!

passages.text:
The guard seems startled as you begin talking, saying that she didn't hear you come in. After exchanging a few pleasantries, it seems as though she is convinced by your disguise. A little too convinced even. She asks you if you'd like to practice sparring with her, as she much prefers to practice with real people than with straw dummies.

[[Accept invitation->Sparring Practice]]
[[Reject invitation->Low Profile]]
passages.name: A Fighting Chance

passages.text:
You exit the armory in your disguise and try your best to look like you know where you're going. Ahead of you is the archway leading into a large room.

[[Go toward the archway->Fit for a King]]
passages.name: On Patrol

passages.text:
Never one to turn down a fight, you accept her invitation and draw your sword. Unfortunately, you very quickly realize that this guard is far more skilled with a blade than you are. You receive blow after blow, and just thank the heavans that she is using a dulled training sword rather than the real thing.

After knocking you to the floor, she pauses and asks you if you are okay.

[[Continue the fight->Red Handed]]
[[Call it off->Admitting Defeat]]
passages.name: Sparring Practice

passages.text:
You decline the guard's invitation, saying that you need to go start your patrol shift. She seems dissapointed, but lets you leave without asking any questions.

[[Leave the armory->On Patrol]]
passages.name: Low Profile

passages.text:
You get back up, claiming that you were going easy on her and that the real fight is about to begin. You exchange a few more blows - with you absorbing all of hers, and her blocking all of yours - until finally your sword makes contact with her cheek. 

Immediately, her cheek begins to bleed and she drops her sword to put pressure on the wound. She becomes visibly upset and asks you why you were using a real sword instead of a dulled training sword. You shrug and say that you didn't know.

She runs off to go get medical treatment, and within minutes the entire castle is on high alert looking for an impostor guard. Soon after, you are found, placed in prison, and executed a few days later.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Red Handed

passages.text:
You admit defeat, to which the guard laughs and asks if you are a new hire. You tell her that you are brand new, and she kindly offers to give you some pointers with your sword technique. She spends the next few minutes teaching you some moves before letting you go on your way.

[[Leave the armory->On Patrol]]
passages.name: Admitting Defeat

passages.text:
You enter into a massive room with a huge dining table in the middle. The table is lined with wooden chairs, with an extravagant throne at the head. 

In addition to the archway behind you, there are three doors in banquet hall: one to the left of the table, one to the right, and one behind it. You wonder if any of them will provide an easy means of escape, but each door has a guard standing on either side of it, so you best not investigate for too long lest they become suspicious.

[[Go through the left door->Throne Room]]
[[Go through the right door->Kitchen]]
[[Go through the door behind the table->Locked out]]

links.name: Go through the door behind the table

passages.name: Fit for a King

passages.text:
You take the door on the left and are met with a grand sight: the throne room. In front of you and to your right is the King, sitting on his golden, jewel-encrusted throne. The entire room is lavishly decorated with paintings, expensive rugs, and intricate statues. Guards are positioned every few feet. There is a staircase at the end of the room leading upwards to what you assume are living quarters, and a hallway behind the throne that appears to lead deeper into the castle.

What catches your interest, though, is a large set of doors directly across from the throne that appears to be the main entrance and exit.

[[Go back to the banquet hall->Fit for a King]] 
[[Go through the doors->Freedom!]]
[[Attack the King->Foiled once again]]

links.name: Go back to the banquet hall

passages.name: Throne Room

passages.text:
You enter the door to the right and find yourself in a crowded kitchen. The room is filled with interesting and delicious smells as well as stressed-looking chefs preparing food. One of the chefs looks up and asks if he can help you.

[[Say that you are checking the status of the King's dinner->Free Sample]]
[[Go back to the banquet hall->Fit for a King]]

links.name: Say that you are checking the status of the King's dinner
Go back to the banquet hall

passages.name: Kitchen

passages.text:
You walk toward the main doors in the most guard-like manner you know how, and exit the castle. Sure enough, you find yourself outside. All you need to do now is keep a low profile until you exit the city.

You walk out of the center of the city toward the outskirts, then eventually out of the walls entirely. Before long, the city is entirely out of view and you are ready to begin your life as an outlaw.

You win!

[[Play again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Freedom!

passages.text:
You draw your sword and begin charging toward the King. However, you don't make it more than a few steps before you are stopped by the many guards in the room. They throw you back in your cell, and you are executed soon after for you crimes.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Foiled once again

passages.text:
You jiggle the doorknob on the door behind the dining table, only to find that it is locked. The guards on either side of the door look at you suspiciously and ask you what you're doing. Panicked, you search for some excuse, but it's no use. The guards quickly realize what's going on and throw you back in your cell. You are executed for your crimes shortly after.

You lose!

[[Try again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: Locked out

passages.text:
The chef tells you that the dinner is almost ready and apologizes for the delay. He explains that the sauce they've made seems to be missing an ingredient, but none of the chefs can figure out what it is. He asks you to sample the sauce to see if you can tell what needs to be added.

[[Agree to taste the sauce->A Sweet Realization]]
[[Say you don't have time for this and leave->Fit for a King]]

links.name: Say you don't have time for this and leave

passages.name: Free Sample

passages.text:
You taste the sauce and immediately realize that the flavor is lacking sweetness. You know just what the chefs should add.

[[Tell them to add sugar->The Perfect Sauce]]
[[Tell them to add pieces of dried fruit->A Fruity Flavor]]
[[Tell them to add lead->Lead the Way]]

links.name: Tell them to add pieces of dried fruit

passages.name: A Sweet Realization

passages.text:
The chef's eyes light up and he pours a scoop of sugar in the sauce. He tastes the sauce and exclaims that it's perfect. He thanks you and bids you farewell.

[[Go back->Fit for a King]]
passages.name: The Perfect Sauce

passages.text:
The chef seems surprised by your suggestion, but chops up a few figs and dates, and mixes them into the sauce. He samples the new mixture and says that he's never tasted anything like it, but the new flavor just might be the perfect compliment to the dish. He tells you that the King is going to love it, and this sauce just might become a staple of the kingdom.

[[Go back->Fit for a King]]
passages.name: A Fruity Flavor

passages.text:
The chef is quiet for a moment as he considers your suggestion, before suddenly he looks at you and exclaims that you are a genius. He adds a handful of lead shavings to the sauce, mixes them in, and samples the sauce. He tells you that the subtle sweetness of the lead in addition to its metallic taste transforms the sauce into a groundbreaking culinary experience.

He begs you to become a chef in his kitchen so that he can use your insight from now on.

[[Accept his job offer->A Happy Ending]]
[[Decline his job offer and go back->Fit for a King]]

links.name: Decline his job offer and go back

passages.name: Lead the Way

passages.text:
The chef invites you to dinner that evening so he can introduce you to the King. Though hesitant, you agree.

During dinner, the guard captain notices that you are not a member of his staff and demands that you explain yourself. You come clean, explaining that you are an escaped prisoner. 

The guard captain calls for your execution, but the King says that he is so impressed with the sauce you helped make that he will not only pardon your crimes, but make you the head chef in his kitchen, effective immediately.

You win! Congratulations!

[[Play again->Dungeon]]
passages.name: A Happy Ending
